ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: a lot of new vocabulary and knowledge on russian culture and history.
I further developed my Russian skills and gained insight into Russian history and culture.
I gained a very deep understanding of Russian history starting from Catherine the Great all the way to around 1870 and developed my Russian vocabulary and grammar skills.
I learned many new grammar rules in Russian, also the history of Russia in the 20th century.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Professor Muravnik is the number one strength of this course. He makes it enjoyable and interesting on a daily basis. His material and teaching style is very helpful for learning. No weaknesses!

Strengths: the professor, the texts, and the other students
Weaknesses: somewhat disorganized, sometimes repetitive
The strengths of this course are how new vocabulary is incorporated into interesting history and how there are many example sentences to practice new Russian verbs.

I really liked everything about the course, from the academic environment to peer relations and the professor's teaching style. I only wish that we could have had this course in person, otherwise, everything was truly great!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. If you want to continue learning Russian at Yale, it's a necessary and great class to take.
Yes. It is a must if you are interested in the Russian major! You must be passionate about the language, however.
Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone interested in Russian history and becoming an advanced speaker of Russian.

Yes, for sure. Especially to those who are interested in the Russian language and history. This course helps students to learn a lot of advanced material in a short amount of time that significantly improves the students' language skills.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
